title: Denmark and Greenland hit Trump administration's intransigence
subhead: Danish Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen and his Greenlandic counterpart, Vivian Motzfeldt, were in Washington on Wednesday for a crisis meeting with Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

title: 'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
France's government survives no-confidence votes as budget deadlock deepens
Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
subhead: Official data released Tuesday show France's birth rate has reached its lowest point in more than a century. When it comes to understanding the decline in births, it is difficult to distinguish between individual choices, social norms and the various constraints faced by couples.

title: Inside Dubai's unprecedented seizure of drug traffickers' real estate assets
subhead: The Marseille prosecutor's office has secured the seizure of around 30 real estate assets in the emirate. This unprecedented success could pave the way for many more operations designed to 'hit criminals in the wallet' at a time when French authorities are eager to demonstrate their commitment to combating money laundering.

title: A rare 16th-century drawing by the master Hans Baldung Grien auctioned in Paris
subhead: The portrait of Susanna Pfeffinger, which has remained within her descendants' family, is valued at between €1.5 million and €3 million.

title: West Bank's Birzeit University still reeling one week after Israeli army fired on students
subhead: Israeli soldiers intervened on January 6 during a rally in solidarity with Palestinian prisoners, at which the film 'The Voice of Hind Rajab' was to be screened. Around a dozen people were injured.

title: Trump says Iran has halted executions stopped as Tehran postpones hanging of protester

Fifty French farmers arrested after storming agriculture ministry building in Paris
After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhead: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.

title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhead: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
